# Example V.A: Faulting Array Index Addresses

As usual, you need SGX-Step. As usual, we assume it is in `../sgx-step/` - adapt the Makefile (`LIBSGXSTEP_DIR`) if needed. We also assume the SGX-SDK is correctly setup and the environment sourced.

Run on our i3-7100U-A at 1 GHz with -260 mV:

```
Creating enclave...
==== Victim Enclave ====
[pt.c] /dev/sgx-step opened!
    Base:   0x7fdbac000000
    Size:   33554432
    Limit:  0x7fdbae000000
    TCS:    0x7fdbada48000
    SSA:    0x7fdbada49f48
    AEP:    0x7fdbb136f73b
    EDBGRD: debug
[main.c] Done
[main.c] 10/10000
[main.c] 20/10000
[main.c] 30/10000
[main.c] 40/10000
[main.c] 50/10000
[main.c] 60/10000
[main.c] 70/10000
[main.c] 80/10000
Signal 11 received
siginfo address = 7fdbab5e7000
Will now map to 7fdbab5e7000
[main.c] Fault fault fault!!!
```
